Passives.Description: Each charge makes your attack do 50% more damage.
Attacks have a chance to knock enemies back (10% chance).
Critical hits deal an additional 1d6 damage.
Your attacks reduce the target's armor by 2 for one turn.
For every consecutive hit, gain +1 to damage rolls (stacking up to 3 times).
Enemies within 5 feet have a -1 penalty to attack rolls against you.
Gain +2 to defense rolls when standing still.
Reduce incoming damage by 2 for each successful hit you land in a turn.
Once per battle, ignore the first instance of damage taken.
Gain temporary health equal to 5% of your max health after a successful attack. It disappears if not attacking or failed attack.
Gain +1 to strength-based checks for each turn you remain in combat.
Gain advantage on saving throws against fear effects.
When you take damage, your next attack deals an additional 1d4 damage.
Gain a +2 to initiative rolls.
Your charge attacks cannot be interrupted.
Gain +1 to all saving throws.
Each time you deal damage, increase your damage by 1 for the next attack.
Gain advantage on saving throws against mind-affecting effects.
Gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against enemies that are flanked.
Regain 1d4 health at the start of your turn if you have taken damage in the previous turn.

Actions.Description: Perform a wide swing that hits all enemies in front of you.
A powerful single-target attack that deals double damage on a critical hit.
Spin around, dealing damage to all adjacent enemies.
Slam your sword into the ground, creating a shockwave that knocks enemies prone.
Charge forward, dealing damage to all enemies in a straight line.
Make a defensive strike that reduces incoming damage by half for one turn.
Strike the ground, causing fissures that deal damage to enemies in a small area.
Use the flat of your sword to bash an enemy, stunning them for one turn.
A powerful downward strike that deals extra damage to prone enemies.
Infuse your attack with elemental energy, dealing an additional 1d4 elemental damage.
A sweeping attack that deals damage to all enemies in a 180-degree arc.
A single powerful attack that deals an additional 1d8 damage if the target is below half health.
Unleash a flurry of strikes, making three attacks against a single target.
Deal damage and reduce the target's damage output by 1d4 for one turn.
Charge at an enemy, dealing damage and knocking them prone.
Make an attack that grants an ally within 10 feet a +2 to their next attack roll.
Release a wave of elemental energy, dealing damage to all enemies in a small radius.
A powerful attack that heals you for half the damage dealt.
Create a swirling vortex of energy that pulls enemies towards you and deals damage.
Make a desperate attack that deals double damage but leaves you vulnerable (disadvantage on next defense roll).

Semi-Actions.Ability: Launch an ally towards a target
Semi-Actions.Description: Use your strength to propel an ally into an enemy, dealing damage.
Make a quick strike that causes the enemy to lose their next action.
Take a defensive stance, gaining +2 to defense rolls until your next turn.
Charge at an enemy, dealing damage and pushing them back 5 feet.
Use your sword to block an incoming attack, reducing damage by half.
If an enemy misses an attack against you, make a free attack in response.
Attempt to knock a weapon from an enemy's hand with a precise strike.
Move to a different location without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Make a quick attack that has a chance to stun the target for one turn.
Create a barrier with your sword, preventing enemies from passing through for one turn.
Shift your position to gain advantage on your next attack roll.
Move away from an enemy while gaining a temporary boost to your defense.
Use a moment to regain your composure, allowing you to reroll a failed defense check.
Distract an enemy, giving you advantage on your next attack against them.
Form a protective barrier with your sword, granting allies within 5 feet a +1 to defense rolls.
Make an attack that interrupts an enemy's spellcasting, forcing them to make a concentration check.
Change your stance to gain a temporary bonus to your next attack based on your movement.
Focus your attack to bypass an enemy's defenses, ignoring their armor for this attack.
Make an aggressive attack that deals extra damage but leaves you vulnerable to counterattacks.
Move an enemy 5 feet in any direction with a successful attack.

Bonus Actions.Description: Gain a temporary shield that absorbs 20 damage for one turn.
Make a quick attack that deals half damage but can be used twice in one turn.
Inspire allies, granting them +1 to attack rolls for one turn.
Regain a small amount of health (1d10) as a surge of adrenaline kicks in.
Gain advantage on your next attack roll.
Increase your damage by 1d4 for your next attack.
Move away from an enemy without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Heal an ally for 1d6 health within 10 feet.
Gain an extra action for this turn, but you cannot use it to attack.
Temporarily imbue your sword with elemental energy, adding 1d4 elemental damage to your next attack.
Regain a small amount of stamina, allowing you to recover from a minor status effect.
Grant an ally within 10 feet an additional action on their next turn.
Gain a temporary +2 to your defense rolls until the start of your next turn.
For one turn, your attacks deal an additional 1d6 damage.
Use your quick reflexes to reposition yourself without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Create a temporary barrier that absorbs elemental damage for one turn.
Gain advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone for one turn.
Boost the morale of your allies, granting them temporary hit points equal to your level.
Instantly regain a small amount of health (1d4) and gain a +1 to your next attack roll.
Your next attack leaves a lingering effect, causing the target to take 1d4 damage at the start of their next turn.

Gain a bonus to elemental damage based on your weapon's element.

Your axe warns you of incoming attacks, granting advantage on defense rolls.

Bonus Actions.Description: Gain a temporary shield that absorbs 20 damage for one turn.
Make a quick attack that deals half damage but can be used twice in one turn.
Inspire allies, granting them +1 to attack rolls for one turn.
Regain a small amount of health (1d10) as a surge of adrenaline kicks in.
Gain advantage on your next attack roll.
Increase your damage by 1d4 for your next attack.
Move away from an enemy without provoking attacks of opportunity.
Heal an ally for 1d6 health within 10 feet.
Gain an extra action for this turn, but you cannot use it to attack.
Temporarily imbue your switch axe with elemental energy, adding 1d4 elemental damage to your next attack.
Regain a small amount of stamina, allowing you to recover from a minor status effect.
Grant an ally within 10 feet an additional action on their next turn.

Passives.Description: Your attacks deal an additional 1d4 damage when you play a song.
Allies within 10 feet gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls when you play a song.
When you play a song, you can heal an ally for 1d6 health.
Your songs last an additional turn before needing to be re-cast.
Gain advantage on performance checks and inspire allies, granting them a +1 to saving throws.
Gain a +2 bonus to initiative rolls while wielding the Hunting Horn.
Allies gain a +1 bonus to their armor class while you are playing a song.
Once per battle, gain an extra action after successfully playing a song.
Gain a temporary shield that absorbs 10 damage after playing a song.
Your songs can grant temporary elemental damage bonuses to allies (1d4).
Gain temporary hit points equal to your level after successfully playing a song.
Use your Dexterity instead of Strength for attack and damage rolls with the Hunting Horn.
Gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls against enemies that are flanked.
Your songs can affect enemies, imposing disadvantage on their next attack roll.
Each consecutive successful attack increases your damage by 1 (stacking up to 3 times).
Regain 1d4 health at the start of your turn if you have played a song in the previous turn.
Gain advantage on attack rolls against a single target for one turn after playing a song.
Your songs can grant temporary hit points equal to your level to allies.
Your songs can be heard from twice the normal distance, allowing allies to benefit from them even if they are further away.
Regain 1d4 health at the start of your turn if you have taken damage in the previous turn.

Actions.Description: Strike the horn to deal damage and create a shockwave that knocks enemies back.

Make a series of rapid strikes that deal damage to all adjacent enemies.
A sweeping attack that deals damage to all enemies in a 180-degree arc while playing a song.

Make a desperate attack that deals double damage but leaves you vulnerable (disadvantage on next defense roll).
Release a wave of sound that deals damage to all enemies in a small radius.
Play a song that allows you to regain a small amount of health (1d4) for each ally within 10 feet.

Infuse your attack with elemental energy, dealing an additional 1d4 elemental damage.
